alert.note: Alert for Hidalgo (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued December 28 at 11:28AM MST until December 28 at 12:00PM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a * Dust Advisory for... West central Hidalgo County in southwestern New Mexico... * Until noon MST. * At 1125 AM MST, an area of blowing dust was detected along I-10 in Hidalgo County between MM7 and MM11. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong winds up to 40 mph. SOURCE...New Mexico DOT road cameras and observation sites. IMPACT...Hazardous travel along I-10 due to drops in visibility. * This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 4 and 17. Locations impacted include... Steins, Road Forks and Lordsburg Playa. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
